Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 eggs (beaten)
- 2 cups milk
- 8 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted

Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a bundt pan or large loaf pan with some of the butter and dust it lightly with flour.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt to combine well. 
3. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the beaten eggs into it. Start incorporating them by pulling in the flour with a wooden spoon or spatula until just combined. Avoid overmixing as this can result in tough cake texture.
4. Gradually pour the milk and remaining butter, alternating between each addition (dry/wet) while continuously stirring. Continue to mix until all ingredients are incorporated and you have a smooth batter with no lumps. 
5. Pour the batter into your prepared bundt or loaf pan, smoothing out the top with a spatula.
6. Bake for about 40-50 minutes in the preheated oven until the cake is golden brown and springs back when lightly pressed on its surface. A toothpick inserted into the center of the cake should come out clean or with just a few crumbs attached, indicating that it's fully baked through.
7. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for about 10 minutes in the pan before transferring the cake onto a wire rack to finish cooling completely. If you used a bundt pan, allow the cake to sit inverted on the rack until cooled.
8. Once fully cooled, you can serve it plain or dust with powdered sugar. Enjoy your homemade buttermilk cake!
